intro: Pouzolzia strigosa, commonly known as the rough pouzolzia, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves that are covered in stiff, bristly hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along canyon walls. Pouzolzia strigosa is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
